intro: Echinocereus acifer subsp. topiensis, commonly known as the Topiño cactus, is a species native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a small, columnar cactus with ribbed stems and spines that are typically reddish in color. The plant produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months, which are followed by red, fleshy fruits. It has a shallow root system adapted to survive in dry, rocky soils. This subspecies is characterized by its compact growth habit and is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats.
